lines.text:
[admiring a baby chick]
Why is it going "cheep cheep"?
Well, would you rather it went "expensive, expensive"?
Is that a joke?
I guess not.
Go sing outside!
But that's not fair! I was here first!
No. I'm the oldest; *I* was here first!
Did you ever wish upon a star?
I once asked Mr. Rogers for his autograph.
Our next song is going to be...
[starts singing]
Yankee Doodle went to town on a horse named Maxi, but Lamb Chop always got there first because she took a taxi!
Little Boy Blue, come blow your nose...

[Shari removes Lamb Chop's headphones]
What happened to the band?
Hey!
Oh, hi, Shari. What's up?
What's up? All the neighbors.
Huh?
Do you know they can hear you all over town?
Is that a new song by The Slobs?
I'm a little teapot, short and stout. Here is my handle...
[curls up left arm]
... and here is my...
[curls up right arm the same way]
... oh darn, I'm a sugar bowl.
[upon discovering that Lamb Chop has the hiccups]
How do you get rid of the hiccups?
Oh! When I get the hiccups, I can ne - *hic* - ever get rid of them!
Lamb Chop...
[Charlie Horse screams at Lamb Chop, and Lamb Chop screams in shock]
Whatever were you doing?
I was trying to scare the hiccups out of you.
You scared the daylights out of me! My hiccups are still fine, thank you. *Hic*
Lamb Chop...
Don't fool around!
I'm not going to touch you! Oh, I know what to do!
[to Lamb Chop]
Look the other way. Now, don't listen.
[Lamb Chop looks the other way]
Now, Charlie Horse, what you have to do is...
[Lamb Chop looks back at Shari]
Don't listen!
[Lamb Chop looks away again]
What you have to do is look at her, and make a horrible face, and you'll scare the hiccups out of her.
Okay, I'll do it. Lamb Chop?
[Lamb Chop screams]
I didn't make a horrible face yet!
Oh! I couldn't tell!
[Charlie Horse is training Hush Puppy to fight against a bully. Hush Puppy is lifting weights]
C'mon higher! Higher! Higher!
[Hush Puppy falls forward and drops the weights]
Are you sure that Arnold Schwarzenegger started like this?
[said every time Lamb Chop wishes to hear a story of her babyhood]

[dreamily]
Tell me about when I was a baby... I was a baby...

[singing before the Comedy Barn segments]
If ever you're at bat and you can feel yourself begin to choke - just step out of the box, *straighten* your socks, and tell yourself a *joke*!
